intro: Crassula exilis subsp. picturata, commonly known as the "Picturata Crassula," is a compact, succulent shrub native to South Africa. It features small, fleshy leaves that are often tinged with red or purple, especially in sunlight. The plant produces clusters of tiny, star-shaped white flowers during the summer months. It is well-suited for rock gardens or as a container plant due to its drought tolerance. Its unique leaf patterns and compact growth make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
